basics.name: Max Wurst
basics.label: Senior Developer
basics.summary: Sarcastic yet oddly effective Senior Developer with 8 years of experience in writing code that occasionally works. Known for turning coffee into questionable software solutions and debugging like it's an Olympic sport. Currently pretending to be productive at TechGiant while secretly plotting world domination through perfectly indented code.

courses: Thesis: 'The Correlation Between Coffee Consumption and Code Quality'
Thesis: 'The Quantum Entanglement of Spaghetti Code and Developer Sanity'

skills.name: Frameworks
keywords: Angular (but only the versions no one uses anymore)

skills.name: Soft Skills
keywords: translating technical jargon into almost-understandable English

work.name: StartupX
highlights: Wrote groundbreaking 'Hello World' programs in 17 different languages
Debugged senior developers' code while they were on coffee breaks
Implemented a revolutionary system for organizing the office snack drawer
Mastered the art of looking busy during pointless meetings
Survived multiple pivots and learned to code faster than the business model could change
Mastered the art of translating 'I don't know' into 'Let me research that and get back to you'
Contributed to open-source projects, mostly by opening issues and forgetting about them
work.summary: Worked in a fast-paced dev environment

work.name: MiniCorp
highlights: Architected scalable solutions while simultaneously scaling the office coffee consumption
Debugged legacy code older than some team members
Implemented agile methodologies, because who doesn't love a good sprint... away from deadlines
Mentored junior developers in the ancient art of Stack Overflow navigation
work.summary: Worked in a fast-paced dev environment

work.name: TechGiant
highlights: Lead a team of developers who miraculously haven't quit yet
Architect scalable solutions that only crash during demos
Implement cutting-edge technologies nobody understands but everyone pretends to
Mentor junior developers in the art of Stack Overflow copying
Key Achievement: Reduced system downtime by 30% by turning it off and on again
work.summary: Worked in a fast-paced dev environment

volunteer.summary: Worked on various open-source community projects.
highlights: Contributed to documentation and bug fixes
Helped organize monthly code sprints

volunteer.summary: Led civic tech projects focused on local government transparency.
highlights: Built data visualizations for city budget reports
Collaborated with city IT on open APIs

awards.title: Bug Whisperer Award
awards.summary: Recognized for fixing the most bugs during Q3.

awards.title: Coffee-to-Code Converter
awards.summary: Awarded for building an AI that brews coffee based on mood detection.

publications.name: Reactive Sarcasm in Software Teams
publications.summary: A lighthearted but insightful piece on team morale and humor.

publications.name: Kubernetes or Coffee Machines?
publications.summary: Compared orchestration systems with coffee workflow management.

references.name: Helga Developer
references.reference: Max is the only developer who can turn sarcasm into solutions.

references.name: Dirk Manager
references.reference: A delightfully chaotic engineer with suspiciously effective output.

projects.name: AutoBug Reporter
projects.description: A tool that automatically creates humorous GitHub issues for bugs.
highlights: Integrated with GitHub and Jira
Includes sarcasm mode powered by GPT

projects.name: SlackSnackBot
projects.description: Office bot that orders snacks based on emoji reactions.
highlights: Connected Slack with snack delivery API
Most used bot in the office
